doc:
Ben Deeley https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ben_Deeley 0 (a corresponding article on Ben Deeley is in the Italian Wikipedia)
Ben Deeley (January 22, 1878 - September 23, 1924) born J. Bernard Deeley also credited as Ben Deely, was an American actor and composer. He appeared in silent films never having lived to the talkie era. He composed a popular ragtime music called The Kleptomaniac Rag in 1913. His best known performance in films is the strange powdered character Mr. Jones in Maurice Tourneur's Victory alongside Lon Chaney, Jack Holt and Wallace Beery. He was at one time married to Marie Wayne, who costarred with him in The Patchwork Girl of Oz and to actress Barbara La Marr. Deeley died of Double pneumonia. ( a_corresponding_article on Ben_Deeley is in the_Italian_Wikipedia ) Ben_Deeley ( January_22_,_1878 - September_23_,_1924 ) born J._Bernard_Deeley also credited as Ben_Deely , was an_American_actor_and_composer . He appeared in silent_films never_having_lived to the_talkie_era . He composed a_popular_ragtime_music called The_Kleptomaniac_Rag in 1913 . His_best_known_performance in films is the_strange_powdered_character_Mr._Jones in Maurice_Tourneur 's_Victory alongside Lon_Chaney , Jack_Holt and Wallace_Beery . He was at one_time married to Marie_Wayne , who costarred with him in The_Patchwork Girl of Oz and to_actress_Barbara_La_Marr . Deeley died of Double_pneumonia .
